result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin A Bey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Threats to Injure/Accuse of Crime [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.30(1).
  • Threats to Injure/Accuse of Crime [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: To sentence that the defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

defendant.name: Bey, Justin A

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Justin A Bey in court with attorney Rodman Wells Streicher.  Defendant Justin A Bey in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:53 AM. State - resolved - defendant would pleas G to counts #1 and #3 as alleged, counts #2, #4 and #5 would be dismissed and read in, on both counts - it is a joint recommendation of 7 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 4 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES - consecutive to each other but concurrent to sentence he is now serving, court costs only on each count. Stricher and Bey agree. State - has complied with victim notification requirements with no response. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2, #4 and #5. Stricher pleads NC for defendant on counts #1 and #3 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing, follow joint recommendation. Stgreicher makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Bey withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #3 - 7 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 4 years of initial confinement and 3 years on ES, consecutive to each other but concurrent to sentence that the defendant is currenlty serving, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, no court costs ordered, not eligible for programs, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 31, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 13, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Rodman Wells Streicher appears via telephone.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge Bloom appears via telephone from Oneida County Courtroom. Called 2:31 PM. Streicher has met with Bey and recieved formal offer from State and would like a PLEAS date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on October 24, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Telephone scheduling conference on September 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Judge Bloom appeares from courtroom in Oneida County via telephone. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No other appearances. Called 3:14 PM. State - unsure of why we are here today and asks court to set the matter for a FPT. Court - agrees that a FPT should be held and will schdule a Telephone scheduling conference for September 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on September 19, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Order to withdraw as counsel signed by Judge Bloom
from Oneida County Criminal Clerk Jean Meyer

Called at 1:43 PM. Judge Bloom appears by telephone. Attorney Chris A. Gramstrup appears for Justin A Bey. Charles Simono appears for the State of Wisconsin. Gramstrup informs court that Bey has changed his mind and is not accepting the plea. Gramstrup asks to be relieved as attorney of record. Court will allow Gramstrup to be relieved but must submit order and court will not sign order until a new attorney is appointed. Gramstrup is to let SPD of his withdrawal and is to inform Bey to contact SPD so a new attorney may be appointed. Set for a STC on 3/15 at 8:30 a.m. Adj. 1:47 PM

Prior: 220 E 6th St, C/O Ashland County Jail, Ashland, WI 54806 United States
9/14/15 hearing - states no longer incarcerated at Ashland County Jail

Defendant Justin A Bey in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup - who appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Defendant Justin A Bey in custody and appears via video from FOSO.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:05 PM. PH was previously waived this AM, Request for Substition has been filed and Judge Bloom believes he will be assigned for judicial economy. Gamstrup has Information, waives reading of it, Bey does not object to the attorney appearing telephonically today, enters NG pleas to all counts. Sets for STC/PTC. Court continues bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Justin A Bey in court, in custody from Ashland County with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 12:03 PM. State - in anticipation of waiving PH, state has filed an information, which mirrors. Court goes over PH form with defendant, and finds the defendant is freely and voluntarily waiving his right to preliminary hearing and finds probable cause was committed and binds over for trial. Gramstrup has filed substitution of judge. Court suggests Judge Bloom to be appointed as he will be here this afternoon. State suggests appearing by phone - both parties agree. ARGN to be scheduled. Bond to be continued.

From defendant's Attorney indicating preliminary hearing will be waived and wishing not to do the ARGN on that date. Letter from Judge indicating the ARGN will proceed on 9/14/15 because the DA has filed an Order to Produce. JA faxed response.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Justin A Bey in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup who appears telephopnically.  Defendant Justin A Bey in custody and appears via video.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:46 AM. Bey and Gamstrup have no objections to appearing telephonically today. Gamstrup has complaint but has not gone over it with the defendant. Bey does not have complaint. State provides complaint to Officer Thornton to give to defendant. Court reads charges and penalties. Bey and Gamstrup understand charges and penalties. Gamstrup waives further reading, enters NG pleas to counts #2 and #4, requests PH and would like to waive time limits. Court accepts pleas on counts #2 and #4. Gamstrup does waive time limits due to the defendant being returned to Ashland County Jail and asks that the matter be set for STC. Court considers time limits waived, sets for PH. State - bond - $5000.00 signature. Gamstrup - no objections. Court - bond - $5000.00 signature bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 11:30 am.
